In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the solution in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s, ' ')
    result = ""
    line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(line * " $word") > text_width
            result *= "$line\n"
            line = ""
        end
        line *= " $word"
    end

    return result * line
end
```

Here is an example:

```julia
println(wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Phasellus sed nibh erat. Sed euismod nisi et sapien convallis, ac sollicitudin lectus mollis."))
```

This will output:

```julia
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, 
consectetur adipiscing elit. 
Phasellus sed nibh erat. Sed 
euismod nisi et sapien convallis, 
ac sollicitudin lectus mollis.
```
